Detailed Description

Definitions for CTK error numbers and error routines.

Function Documentation

int ctk_error_translate_unix ( int  unix_error  ) 

Translate the tSDK internal error code to CTK error code

void ctk_perror ( int  errnum,
const char *  msg 
)

Prints out an error message corresponding to the given error code to stderr.

Parameters:
[in] errnum - the error code
[in] msg - the error message which will be printed as the first part of the error message.

const char* ctk_strerror ( int  errnum  ) 

Returns string describing the given error code

Parameters:
[in] errnum - the error code
Returns:
the error message corresponding to the given error code. If the given error code does not fall in the range CTK_ERROR_BASE < errnum < CTK_ERROR_BASE + ctk_nerr, ctk_strerror returns "Unknown error".

int ctk_strerror_r ( int  errnum,
char *  buf,
int  buflen 
)

Returns string describing the given error code

Parameters:
[in] errnum - the error code
[out] buf - pointer to store the error message, which must be allocated by the caller.
[in] buflen - the length of the buffer
Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) on success, -1 on failure.

static int is_ctk_error ( int  errnum  )  [inline, static]

Returns true or false to indicate whether the given errno is in the range of ctk_error or not.
